title: So is their anyone that;s still sportsman like in the game anymore?
body:
its been well over a month since i've seen someone i enjoyed playing with that is not an irl friend
and enemies are just as bad
people are so petty and toxic they go out of their way to fuck over your game because the enemy team banned their champ, they call cuss you out as much as they want as they will never get banned if they don't use of the 3 key words that proc they auto system

so idk why people are trying to add the honorable opponent options, cuz chances are they just aren't using all chat and have just as much as a shit hole of 11 year old cry baby allies as you do

replies.body:
I mean the game trains people to be toxic from level 1. 
You que up for a bot game, then load in and see summoners rift for the first time. A little overwhelmed, you start exploring. By the time you reach an inhib turret, you're most likely already being spam pinged and yelled at in chat for "taking my lane". 
Then you get to pvp and you don't really get to learn. There's a really good chance that you're with/against people who've played before (people who got banned or smurfs), and theyll yell at you for any non optimal thing you're doing. 

If they dont fix the new player experience, I doubt toxicity will start die anywhere else.

Today a fiora stomped me in lane (i was gp and she was like 25 cs and a kill ahead) I played like a kitty and had to get mid and jungle help to chase and kill her in jungle 2 times. Didn't say anything like "OMG bring more" "win lane lose game" "better mid/jg wins". I say that is a pretty sportsmanlike person, not a single bs in the all chat when she deserved to win the game much more than I did.
I only play a couple of times a week, but I'd have someone cool in my team more often than not.

There are those who still think honor and respect is important. Not riots version of honor, i mean real honor. Those people are usually silent though because honor and respect is treated as some sort of uncool fucking snowflake trait. Its pretty sickening.

I'm at D4 MMR (at the moment) and people even here are honorable IF everyone snowballs hard and wins lane.   Of course everyone likes each other (or pretends to).

But if anyone does bad everyone hates you.  Toxic cesspool if people don't smash their lanes.

*Edit* 2-0'd my d4 series.  Out of Elo hell.  And bragging about it too.
